sen.j: 灌仏会（かんぶつえ）は、釈迦の誕生を祝う行事である。
sen.e: Kanbutsue is a ceremony that celebrates the birth of Buddha.
Kanbutsue is a ceremony that celebrates the birth of Buddha.
Kanbutsue is a ceremony that celebrates the birth of Buddha.

sen.j: 毎年4月8日に行われる。
sen.e: It is held on April 8 every year.
It is held on April 8 every year.
It is held on April 8 every year.

sen.j: 釈迦（ゴータマ・シッダッタ）が4月8日 (旧暦)に生まれたという伝承に基づく。
sen.e: It is based on the tradition that says Buddha (Gotama Siddhattha) was born on April 8 (old lunar calendar).
It is based on the tradition that says Buddha (Gotama Siddhattha) was born on April 8 (old lunar calendar).
It is based on the tradition that says Buddha (Gotama Siddhattha) was born on April 8 (old lunar calendar).

sen.j: 降誕会（ごうたんえ）、仏生会（ぶっしょうえ）、浴仏会（よくぶつえ）、龍華会（りゅうげえ）、花会式（はなえしき）、花祭（はなまつり）の別名もある。
sen.e: The ceremony is also known as Goutane, Busshoe, Yokubutsue, Ryugee, Hanashikie and Hanamatsuri.
The ceremony is also known as Goutane, Busshoe, Yokubutsue, Ryugee, Hanashikie and Hanamatsuri.
The ceremony is also known as Gotane, Busshoe, Yokubutsue, Ryugee, Hanaeshiki and Hanamatsuri.

sen.j: 釈迦誕生の時に、龍が天から飛来して、香湯（ソーマ、アムリタ）をそそいだという故事に基づくものである。
sen.e: It is based on the tradition that dragons came down from the sky to pour Koto (fragranced hot water) (soma, amrita) when Buddha was born.
It is based on the tradition that dragons came down from the sky to pour Koto (fragrant hot water) (soma, amrita) when Buddha was born.
It is based on the tradition that dragons came down from the sky to pour Koto (fragrant hot water) (soma, amrita) when Buddha was born.

sen.j: 本来は旧暦で行われるものである。
sen.e: The ceremony should be held based on the old lunar calendar in nature.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This ceremony should be held based on the old lunar calendar in nature.
This ceremony should be held based on the old lunar calendar in nature.

sen.j: 日本では近年は新暦で、又は、それに近い日曜日に行われることが多くなってきている。
sen.e: It started to be more often celebrated based on the solar calendar or on Sunday that is close to the date in recent years in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It started to be celebrated more often based on the solar calendar or on Sunday that is closer to the date in recent years in Japan.
It started to be celebrated more often based on the solar calendar or on Sunday that is closer to the date in recent years in Japan.

sen.j: 韓国では現在でも旧暦で行われており、「釈迦誕生日」として法定祝日となっている。
sen.e: Korea still holds the ceremony based on the old lunar calendar, and designates the day as a statutory holiday known as 'Buddha's birthday.'
Korea still holds the ceremony based on the old lunar calendar, and designates the day as a statutory holiday known as 'Buddha's birthday.'
Korea still holds the ceremony based on the old lunar calendar, and designates the day as a statutory holiday known as 'Buddha's birthday.'

sen.j: これはクリスマスが法定祝日となっていることから、
sen.e: Christmas has been designated as a statutory holiday.
Christmas has been designated as a statutory holiday.
Christmas has been designated as a statutory holiday.

sen.j: 一つの宗教だけを特別扱いしないための配慮である。
sen.e: As a result, consideration was given not to give special treatment to one particular religion.
As a result, consideration was given not to give special treatment to one particular religion.
As a result, consideration was given not to give special treatment to one particular religion.

sen.j: 仏誕に関しては、2月8日 (旧暦)（インド暦第二の月・ヴェサーカ）説もある。
sen.e: Another tradition tells that Buddha was born on February 8 (old lunar calendar) (The second month of the Indian calendar, Vaisakha).
Another tradition tells that Buddha was born on February 8 (old lunar calendar) (The second month of the Indian calendar, Vaisakha).
Another tradition tells that Buddha was born on February 8 (old lunar calendar) (The second month of the Indian calendar, Vaisakha).

sen.j: 風習
sen.e: Custom
Custom
Custom

sen.j: 日本では、様々な草花で飾った花御堂（はなみどう）を作って、
sen.e: In Japan, people make a hanamido (literally, "blossom temple") decorated with various plants and flowers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In Japan, people make a hanamido (literally, "blossom temple") decorated with various plants and flowers.
In Japan, people make a hanamido (literally, "blossom temple") decorated with various plants and flowers.

sen.j: その中に灌仏桶を置き、甘茶を満たす。
sen.e: Inside the hanamido, a Kanbutsu-oke tub is placed to be filled with amacha (hydrangea tea).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Inside the hanamido, a Kanbutsu-oke tub is placed to be filled with amacha (hydrangea tea).
Inside the hanamido, a Kanbutsu-oke tub is placed to be filled with amacha (hydrangea tea).

sen.j: 誕生仏の像をその中央に安置し、柄杓で像に甘茶をかけて祝う。
sen.e: A Buddha statue is placed at the center and poured with amacha with a tea ladle for celebration.
A Buddhist statue is placed at the center and amacha is poured over it with a tea ladle as a celebration.
A Buddhist statue is placed at the center and amacha is poured over it with a tea ladle as a celebration.

sen.j: 甘茶をかけるのは、釈迦の誕生時、産湯を使わせるために9つの竜が天から清浄の水を注いだとの伝説に由来する。
sen.e: People pour amacha based on the tradition that nine dragons poured sacred water from the sky to be used for Buddha's first bath when he was born.
People pour amacha based upon the legend that nine dragons poured sacred water from the sky to be used for Buddha's first bath when he was born.
People pour amacha based upon the legend that nine dragons poured sacred water from the sky to be used for Buddha's first bath when he was born.

sen.j: 宗派に関係なくどの寺院でも行う（但し釈迦を本仏としない富士門流（日蓮正宗等）は除く）。
sen.e: Any temple holds the ceremony regardless of its sect (except for the Fujimon school (including the Nichiren Shoshu Sect) whose principal object of worship is not Buddha.
All temples hold the ceremony regardless of the sect (except for the Fujimon school (including the Nichiren Shoshu Sect) whose principal object of worship is not Buddha.
The event can take place at any temple irrespective of the sect (with the exception of the Nichiren Sho sect's Fujimon school (where Buddha is not the principal deity)).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。スペル修正しました。

sen.j: 甘茶は参拝者にもふるまわれる。
sen.e: Worshippers are also offered with amacha.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Worshippers are also offered amacha.
Worshippers are also offered amacha.

sen.j: 甘茶で習字をすれば上達すると言われる。
sen.e: Amacha is believed to help people improving their calligraphy skills.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Amacha is believed to help people improve their calligraphy skills.
Amacha is believed to help people improve their calligraphy skills.

sen.j: 害虫よけのまじないを作ったりもする。
sen.e: It is also used as a charm to repel pests.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is also used as a charm to repel pests.
It is also used as a charm to repel pests.

sen.j: 南伝仏教や蔵伝仏教では5月頃に行うウェーサク祭やサガダワ祭が灌仏会に相当する。
sen.e: Theravada Buddhism and Tibetan Buddhism hold Vesakh festival and Saga Wada festival around May, respectively, as an equivalent of Kanbutsue.
Theravada Buddhism and Tibetan Buddhism hold Vesakh festival and Saga Wada festival around May, respectively, as an equivalent of Kanbutsue.
Theravada Buddhism and Tibetan Buddhism hold Vesakh festival and Saga Wada festival around May, respectively, as an equivalent of Kanbutsue.

sen.j: 一方、日蓮正宗では日蓮の誕生日にあたる2月16日に「御誕生会」が行われ、
sen.e: On the other hand, the Nichiren Shoshu Sect holds 'The Birthday Party' on February 16, when Nichiren was born.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On the other hand, the Nichiren Shoshu Sect holds 'The Birthday Party' on February 16, when Nichiren was born.
On the other hand, the Nichiren Shoshu Sect holds 'The Birthday Party' on February 16, when Nichiren was born.

sen.j: 大石寺では御影堂での法要の後、五重塔で御塔開きのお経が行われる。
sen.e: At Taiseki-ji Temple, after memorial service is held at the Goei-do Hall (hall dedicated to the sect's founder), a sutra is recited to open the five-storied pagoda.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At Taiseki-ji Temple, after a memorial service is held at the Goei-do Hall (hall dedicated to the sect's founder), a sutra is recited to open the five-storied pagoda.
At Taiseki-ji Temple, after a memorial service is held at the Goei-do Hall (hall dedicated to the sect's founder), a sutra is recited to open the five-storied pagoda.

sen.j: なお、花まつりの名称は、明治時代に浄土宗で採用された呼称で、
sen.e: The notation of Hanamatsuri was adopted by the Jodo Sect during the Meiji Period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The notation of Hanamatsuri was adopted by the Jodo Sect during the Meiji Period.
The notation of Hanamatsuri was adopted by the Jodo Sect during the Meiji period.

sen.j: それ以来、宗派を問わず灌仏会の代名詞として用いられている。
sen.e: Since then, it has been used to refer to Kanbutsue regardless of sects.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since then, it has been used to refer to Kanbutsue regardless of sects.
Since then, it has been used to refer to Kanbutsue regardless of sects.

sen.j: お寺が経営している幼稚園や保育園では、こちらの名称の方がよく知られている。
sen.e: The notation is more familiar among nursery schools and kindergartens run by temples.
The notation is more familiar among nursery schools and kindergartens run by temples.
The notation is more familiar among nursery schools and kindergartens run by temples.

sen.j: 子どもたちにとっては、甘茶をいただく日。
sen.e: The day is for children to be given amacha.
The day is for children to be given amacha.
The day is for children to be given amacha.

sen.j: 又、稚児行列を出す寺も多い。
sen.e: Also, many temples feature chigogyoretsu (kids parade).
Also, many temples feature chigogyoretsu (children's parade).
Also, many temples feature chigogyoretsu (children's parade).

sen.j: 失敗して物をダメにする事を「おしゃかになる」と表現するが、これは灌仏会に因むものである。
sen.e: In Japanese, to ruin things by mistake is described as 'Oshaka-ni-naru (becoming Buddha),' which relates to Kanbutsue.
In Japanese, to ruin things by mistake is described as 'Oshaka-ni-naru (becoming Buddha),' which relates to Kanbutsue.
In Japanese, to ruin things by mistake is described as 'Oshaka-ni-naru (becoming Buddha),' which relates to Kanbutsue.

sen.j: 江戸の鍛冶職人の隠語として、あぶり過ぎて鈍ってダメにしてしまった金物に対して使用する。
sen.e: Smithies in Edo used the platter to describe failed metallic products due to overroasting.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Smithies in Edo used the platter to describe failed metallic products due to overroasting.

sen.j: 江戸っ子訛りで「しがつよかった（火が強かった）」＝「四月八日だ」＝釈迦の誕生日、というつながりで成立したとされる。
sen.e: The platter is believed to have been derived from 'Shi-ga-tsuyo-katta' in their Edo accent, which can be heard as 'Shigatsu-yokka (April 8),' which is Buddha's birthday.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
